description: Movie Explorer is a React-based web application designed to let users discover movies from various genres using the TMDB API.

For this project, I collaborated with a web developer and a UX design student at Technigo Bootcamp to create a community hub website for connecting users, joining support groups, and promoting kindness.
This project is a personal portfolio website that highlights the skills, journey, and projects of a developer. I created the site based on a provided Figma design.
A fun, multi-step form that lets users create their own superhero, from name to costume to superpower. Built in collaboration with another development student.

This backend API for the Happy Thoughts app, built with Express.js and MongoDB (via Mongoose), lets users post, retrieve, and like thoughts. Data is stored in MongoDB, and likes update a heart count for each thought.
This React app lets users share happy thoughts, view submitted messages, and see like counts. It features thought submission validation, a character counter, and a heart animation for added fun.

This web app displays a collection of albums with details, a play button for Spotify, and a sidebar of editor’s picks. It fetches data from the Spotify API and uses React components for modularity and reusability.

This weather app lets users search for current conditions and a 4-day forecast. It pulls data from OpenWeatherMap, showing temperature, weather, sunrise/sunset times, and adjusts its theme based on day or night.
This interactive chatbot helps users order food from a fictional seafood restaurant, guiding them through the menu and order confirmation.
This team project involved building a recipe library with features for filtering, sorting, and random selection.
This is an ordering system for a pizzeria and café, allowing users to select from a variety of food and drink options.
This is a responsive website for a fictional concert venue, 'Concert House', focusing on user registration and mobile-friendly navigation.
This website, created for a boot camp project, focuses on 'weaving' and practices HTML, CSS, and responsive design across devices.
